tool.name: ApplyFilterbyID
tool.displayname: Apply Filters to Collection Dataset by Asset ID

param.name: data_type
param.displayname: Choose the type of the dataset to be filtered
param.dialogReference: Select the type of the Earth Engine dataset between feature collection and image collection

param.name: asset_id
param.displayname: Specify the asset ID of the dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the asset ID of the dataset.

param.name: filter_list
param.dialogReference: Select filters and apply arguments. For example, to filter by date, choose filter ee.Filter.date and apply argument in this format '2015-01-01', '2018-01-01'. Another example, to filter by equal, choose filter ee.Filter.eq and apply argument in this format 'CLOUD_COVER', 0. You can apply as many filters as needed.

param.name: out_json
param.displayname: Specify the output JSON file to save the serialized object
param.dialogReference: Save the filtered dataset as a serialized JSON object for future use. When you use this JSON file again, the dataset already has the filters applied.

tool.summary:
This script applies filters to feature collection or image collection by asset ID, and saves the filtered dataset to serialized JSON object for future use.

To browser all available earth engine filters, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/apidocs/ee-filter.

For a quick guide on filtering feature collection, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/feature_collection_filtering.

For a quick guide on filtering image collection, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/ic_filtering

idCitation.resTitle: Apply Filters to Collection Dataset by Asset ID
